abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column highlights report published by Economic Policy Institute in Washington and Institute of Education at Higher School of Economics in Moscow that suggests American schools underperform compared to other countries' schools because of failure to account for socioeconomic deficits; notes that report could change debate over education policy in United States, as it is unjust to blame schools for societal problems they have no control over.
lead_paragraph: In tests, American students fall behind their peers in many countries, but adjusting for demography and access to resources gives a different picture.

headline.main: School vs. Society in America’s Failing Students
headline.print_headline: America’s Students Are Lagging. Maybe It’s Not the Schools.

snippet: In tests, American students fall behind their peers in many countries, but adjusting for demography and access to resources gives a different picture.

keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
keywords.name: organizations
